bill_title: provide grants to certain communities for the development or enhancement of websites to promote tourism and economic development and to make an appropriation therefor.
keywords: Department of Tourism and State Development

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide grants to certain communities for the development or enhancement of websites to promote tourism and economic development and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the employer's investment in South Dakota's future fund the sum of one hundred thirteen thousand five hundred dollars ($113,500), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Tourism and State Development to provide grants, not to exceed five hundred dollars each, to communities in the state with a population of at least one hundred but less than ten thousand, which shall be used to develop or enhance a website to promote tourism and economic development within the community. Section 2. The secretary of the Department of Tourism and Economic Development shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 3. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2005, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
